contentrichtext.text: {{about|the type of bird}} {{Taxobox | name = Forktails | image = Little Forktail.jpg | image_width = 250px | image_caption = [[Little Forktail]]<br/>''Enicurus scouleri'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Aves]] | ordo = [[Passeriformes]] | familia = [[Muscicapidae]] | genus = '''''Enicurus''''' | genus_authority = [[Coenraad Jacob Temminck|Temminck]], 1822 | subdivision_ranks = Species | subdivision = See text. }} The '''forktails''' are small [[insectivore|insectivorous]] [[bird]]s in the [[genus]] ''Enicurus''. They were formerly in the [[thrush (bird)|thrush]] family [[Turdidae]], but are more often now treated as part of the [[Old World flycatcher]] family Muscicapidae. Their name derives from their long forked tail.<ref name = "HBW">{{Citation | first = Nigel | last = Collar | editor-first = Josep | editor-last = del Hoyo | editor2-first = Andrew | editor2-last = Elliott | editor3-first = David | editor3-last = Christie | contribution = Family Turdidae (Thrushes) | title = [[Handbook of the Birds of the World]]. Volume 10, Cuckoo-shrikes to Thrushes | year = 2005 | pages = 805–807| place = Barcelona | publisher = Lynx Edicions | isbn = 84-87334-72-5 }}</ref> These are southeast [[Asia]]n forest species principally associated with mountain forests and streams. Most nest in rock crevices, laying 2-4 [[egg (biology)|eggs]]. ==Species== * [[Little Forktail]], ''Enicurus scouleri'' * [[Sunda Forktail]], ''Enicurus velatus'' * [[Chestnut-naped Forktail]], ''Enicurus ruficapillus'' * [[Black-backed Forktail]], ''Enicurus immaculatus'' * [[Slaty-backed Forktail]], ''Enicurus schistaceus'' * [[White-crowned Forktail]], ''Enicurus leschenaulti'' :*[[Bornean Forktail]], ''Enicurus (leschenaulti) borneensis''<ref>{{cite journal|last=Moyle|first=Robert|coauthors=Menno Schilthuizen, Mustafa A. Rahman and [[Fred Sheldon (ornithologist)|Frederick H. Sheldon]],|year=2005|title=Molecular phylogenetic analysis of the white-crowned forktail ''Enicurus leschenaulti'' in Borneo|journal=Journal of Avian Biology|volume=36|issue=2|pages=96–101|doi=10.1111/j.0908-8857.2005.03510.x}}</ref> * [[Spotted Forktail]], ''Enicurus maculatus'' ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Enicurus|*]]
